items.personal_notes: This book reminds me of the beauty of unexpected love and the importance of not judging too quickly. I always find myself getting lost in the world of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, rooting for their happily ever after.

items.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
In a separate pan, cook pancetta or guanciale until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Season with black pepper.
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan with pancetta/guanciale and garlic. Toss to combine.

Remove pan from heat and quickly pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring vigorously to coat the pasta. If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water gradually to achieve desired consistency.
Season with salt to taste. Serve immediately, garnished with chopped parsley.
items.personal_notes: Cooking spaghetti carbonara always takes me back to my trip to Italy. The aroma of garlic and crispy pancetta fills my kitchen, transporting me to the streets of Rome. It's my little taste of Italy at home.
